name: Il Rosolaccio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first, I was reluctant to write about this absolutely fantastic place for fear that it would be overrun. As I am a very experienced traveller who has stayed at countryside Hotels and Inns around the world, this is one of the more magnificent places that I have stayed at. The rooms are more than basic with flat TVs and good size. Our room's windows overlooked the beautiful Tuscany landscape. The owner has plants around the hotel that are looked after with perfection. The house bottled wine is extremely reasonable and light. I can go on and on. If you want to relax after driving and navigating those roads in Italy and also been mobbed in museums, galleries, and big cities, this is the place to drive to and stay a few nights and use it as a base to explore the rest of Tuscany.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem, one of the best countryside escapes in all of Italy

reviews.text: We had a wonderful 6-day stay at Il Rosolaccio which is one of those lovely old farmhouses perched high above the road that has been lovingly restored with very modern amenities while retaining old, rustic charm. It's in a great location between San Gimignano and Certaldo, both interesting towns. Ingka and Ingrid are the perfect hosts at this truly wonderful place. Though the temperature was in the 90's during our stay, our corner room with cross-ventilation from the windows was delightful with a spectular view of the Tuscan countryside. And the good-sized swimming pool, overlooking a beautiful view, was totally refreshing on those hot summer days!
reviews.title: We loved Il Rosolaccio!
Like coming home
reviews.text: Il Rosolaccio is set up in such a way that it is very easy to meet other guests - and we met some wonderful people from several different countries. A bountiful breakfast buffet is set up each morning with tables on the back patio where the sun rises. Dinners in front of the house, watching the sun set each night, were terrific and very reasonable with a wonderful house wine!

aka: Il Rosolaccio San Gimignano, Italy - Tuscany
description: Il Rosolaccio is an old Tuscan farmhouse in the hills between Florence and Siena.Over the centuries its buildings have been enlarged by different families of farmers who cultivated vine, olives and sunflower.Today, Il Rosolaccio has been restored with 6 apartments and 6 rooms of varying sizes available to rent and B&B. Each room and apartment has maintained its original rustic character with the advantage of self-contained bathrooms.
